title: DRC: Clash between armed forces and protesters in Congo kills at least 48
description: The conflict opposed Congolese soldiers to members of a religious sect protesting Western organizations operating in the country, a local official said on Thursday, August 31.

title: Pharaoh Amenhotep II gave his wet nurse the royal treatment
description: Upon her death around 3,450 years ago, the woman received embalming usually reserved for the elite. A secret revealed by the analysis of the residue of two canopic jars used to store her viscera found in a tomb in the Valley of the Kings.

title: FIFA president breaks his silence: Rubiales kiss 'should never have happened'
description: Gianni Infantino reacted for the first time on Thursday, August 31, to the forced kiss from the president of the Royal Spanish Football Federation (RFEF), on the world champion Jenni Hermoso.

title: Pope to meet tiny Catholic community of Mongolia
description: Francis' visit from September 1 to September 4, 2023, marks the desert country's first-ever visit from a pontiff. The nation's geographical situation – sandwiched between Russia and China – could be the reason the Vatican wants to put it on its map.

title: In Lebanon, a bill decriminalizing homosexuality arouses violent resistance
description: The text has provoked very hostile reactions, culminating in the attack on a gay event in Beirut by a small Christian extremist group on Wednesday, August 23.

title: Huge landslide in eastern France increases climate change concerns
description: After the recent heatwave followed by heavy downpours, part of the cliff face in a section of the Maurienne valley in Savoie known to be unstable came crashing down, forcing traffic routes to be temporarily closed.

title: Paris  fumigates for tiger mosquitoes due to European invasion
description: This was the first time the French capital had insecticide sprayed on trees, green spaces and other likely mosquito-breeding grounds.

title: 'French Bukkake' case: Porn violence suspects ordered to stand trial
description: The investigation into the 'French Bukkake' affair – named after a production and distribution site run by Pascal Ollitrault – was carried out by the gendarmes of the Paris investigative unit

title: Proud Boys leader gets 17-year sentence for US Capitol attack
description: The sentence for Joseph Biggs is the second longest among hundreds of Capitol riot cases so far, after the 18-year prison sentence for Oath Keepers founder Stewart Rhodes.

title: Trump pleads not guilty in Georgia election fraud case, waives arraignment
description: The former president turned himself in at Fulton County Jail in Atlanta last week, where he had his mug shot taken.

title: Niger's new military regime orders French ambassador's expulsion
description: On Friday, the new rulers gave Sylvain Itté 48 hours to leave the country but France declared they had no right to remove him.

title: Ukrainian foreign minister: 'Russia is Europe's biggest enemy'
description: At the end of a visit to Paris, Dmytro Kuleba spoke to Le Monde about developments in the conflict with Russia, Africa and former French president Sarkozy's latest statements.

title: Gabon coup: General Oligui to be sworn in as 'transitional president' on Monday
description: Announcement of the military coup came early Wednesday morning,  moments after the national election overseer declared Ali Bongo Ondimba had won a third term.

title: Gabon's General Oligui Nguema, the leader of a palace revolution
description: Known as a popular moderate, the commander-in-chief of Gabon's Republican Guard is a distant cousin of President Ali Bongo Ondimba, whom he overthrew on Wednesday.

title: Jailed Russian nationalist declares presidential bid
description: Igor Girkin, better known by his alias Igor Strelkov, was detained on extremism charge in July for criticizing Russia's leadership. He also piled fresh criticism on President Vladimir Putin.

title: In photos: After Hurricane Idalia, Florida is hit by major flooding
description: The hurricane, which brought winds of up to 150 km/h, was finally downgraded to a tropical storm on Wednesday evening.

title: Macron's talks with party leaders: 'Past midnight, we got down to the reality of people's lives'
description: The 12 hours of debates with political leaders from his ruling coalition and the opposition included widely consensual issues like the war in Ukraine as well as more contentious topics like immigration and wages.

title: Hardline union leader warns Macron situation in France is 'serious'
description: In a meeting with the French president, the new CGT leader Sophie Binet outlined her organization's demands and warned him that mounting disagreements between workers and the government favored the far right.

title: Toulouse is moving its triumphal arch 33 meters
description: The monument to the servicemen of Haute-Garonne is being relocated to allow construction of the southern French city's third subway line.

title: British Defense Secretary Ben Wallace resigns
description: Wallace has been in the UK parliament for 18 years and was the longest-serving Conservative defense secretary since Winston Churchill.

title: Macron holds 12-hour discussion with party leaders behind closed doors
description: Conservative leader Eric Ciotti said he was 'unconvinced' after the talks, which far-right leader Jordan Bardella said were 'frank.' The left expressed disappointment about the debates.

title: Pierre Castel, the brewer of a fortune in Africa
description: The Frenchman aged 96 has built up a beer empire with sales of €5 billion and 40,000 employees in some 20 countries.

title: South Africa: Over 50 killed in building fire
description: The death count is expected to rise following a blaze that ripped through a multi-story building in Johannesburg that had been overtaken by homeless people.

title: Gabon: France faces a new coup in its old African stomping grounds
description: For Paris, Wednesday's putsch differs from the one in Niger on July 26, notably in its absence of hostility toward the former colonial power. Neither military cooperation nor development aid has been cut off.

title: China's Baidu rolls out ChatGPT rival ERNIE
description: ERNIE Bot is the first domestic AI app to be fully available to the public in China. It is not available outside the country.

title: US approves direct military aid to Taiwan for the first time
description: The US State Department insisted that the first-ever aid under the program did not imply any recognition of the sovereignty of Taiwan.

title: 'The percentage of people in France who think there are too many immigrants has been falling sharply for years'
description: Although widespread French xenophobia is taken for granted, it is in fact steadily declining. Louis Maurin, director of France's Inequalities Observatory, argues that this state of affairs should encourage politicians to detach themselves from opinion polls.

title: Media organizations block ChatGPT and OpenAI from accessing their websites
description: Press publishers have raised concerns for months about unauthorized utilization of their content for AI software training, advocating for compensation and consent.

title: North Korea fires two short-range ballistic missiles
description: The missile launches – first reported by the South Korean military – came amid Washington and Seoul's annual Ulchi Freedom Shield exercises, which always infuriate Pyongyang.

title: The wealthiest nation on earth must cease the shocking absence of healthcare for its citizens
description: Washington released a list of 10 drugs for price negotiations between pharmaceutical companies and Medicare, which might have effects internationally, cautions Philippe Escande, 'Le Monde' economics writer.

title: British Museum in turmoil over thefts and demands for restitution
description: The resignation of London museum director Hartwig Fischer on August 25 highlights the fragility of an increasingly contested pillar of the British establishment.

title: Russia vetoes UN attempt to maintain experts in Mali
description: Russia exercised its veto power to block the proposal led by Mali's former colonial power France and the United Arab Emirates amidst criticism of alleged abuses by Wagner mercenaries hired by the junta.

title: Viktor Orban looks to strengthen ties in the Balkans
description: Increasingly isolated within the European Union due to his pro-Russian stance, the Hungarian Prime Minister is seeking allies in this region by stepping up investments, notably in Serbia.

title: US Open: Djokovic and Switaken dominate, Tsitsipas stunned in upset
description: Coco Gauff also cruised into the third round with a 6-3, 6-2 victory over 16-year-old Russian Mirra Andreeva in the sweltering New York heat.
